channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Oracle’s blockbuster earnings swell Larry Ellison’s fortune by $100 billion in 30 minutes to put him neck and neck with Elon Musk
item.description: Only $1 billion separates the two richest men in the world after a wild day of trading.

item.title: Social media trounces old media gatekeepers as news source for gory Charlie Kirk assassination video
item.description: Video was easy to find on X, TikTok, YouTube — even on Truth Social, where President Trump posted official word of the conservative activist's death.

item.title: Keir Starmer fires ‘Prince of Darkness’ Peter Mandelson, ambassador to U.S., over fresh revelations of Epstein links
item.description: On Wednesday, The Sun published emails that it said showed Mandelson telling Epstein to “fight for early release," adding "I think the world of you."

item.title: Why the Smartest Brands Swim Away From the Competition (and 3 Ways They Do It)
item.description: When you can successfully create a new market space for yourself, you can worry less about the competition.

item.title: Writing from my cell in the age of prison Wi-Fi
item.description: It was the Fourth of July, and I was in my Sing Sing cell, sweating in the heat, perched on the edge of my bunk with my feet dunked in a bucket of col...

item.title: Feeling Lonely? Neuroscience Says Put on Some Music
item.description: Isolation and detachment from others is bad for your health. Playing some tunes can blunt the effects of loneliness and help you feel better.

item.title: Texas A&M fires English professor over children’s literature course that critics called ‘DEI and LGBTQ indoctrination’
item.description: The professor's lawyer said she had "taught this course and others like it for many years, successfully and without challenge.”

item.title: Changing face of America revealed by Census Bureau: White population dips to 56.3%, numbers of non-married grow
item.description: The United States became more demographically diverse from 2023 to 2024.

item.title: How to Break Up With Bad Technology
item.description: When is it time to pivot, and how do you do it?

item.title: South Korea confirms 330 detainees released from Georgia facility following massive ICE raid
item.description: South Korea’s president said Thursday that Korean companies will likely hesitate to make further investments in the United States unless Washington im...

item.title: Inflation got worse in August as prices jumped on gas and food
item.description: Inflation rose last month as the price of gas, groceries , hotel rooms and airfares rose, along with the cost of clothes and used cars. Consumer price...

item.title: The ‘Job Hugging’ Panic Is Overblown. Here’s Why HR Should Celebrate It
item.description: Turning the practice of people staying at their jobs into a source of worry is a non-problem being escalated to a momentary trend.

item.title: Safeway closing stores: Full list of doomed locations as the Albertsons-owned grocery chain trims footprint
item.description: Supermarket chain Safeway is reportedly planning close 12 of its stores in the coming weeks. The grocer, which is a subsidiary of Albertsons Companies...

item.title: Are You an Entrepreneur? You’re (Darn) Right You Are
item.description: And so is everyone else who tries to chart their own course. So let’s stop arguing about it, and start encouraging.

item.title: Stocks on Wall Street rise ahead of new U.S. inflation data and job numbers
item.description: Wall Street pointed toward a third consecutive day of records before the opening bell Thursday ahead of new U.S. data releases on the labor market and...
